intro: Piper rojasii, commonly known as the Río Negro pepper or the Andean pepper, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes many species of pepper plants. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are tiny, round berries that turn red when mature, and they are often used in traditional medicine. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some medicinal properties according to local folklore.
